title: Candide
creator: Voltaire
description:
Librivox recording of Candide by Voltaire. Read by Ted Delorme Candide is a relentless, brutal assault on government, society, religion, education, and, above all, optimism. Dr. Pangloss teaches his young students Candide and Cunegonde that everything in this world is for the best, a sentiment they cling to as the world steps in to teach them otherwise. The novel is brilliant, hilarious, blasphemous. . . and Voltaire never admitted to writing it. (Summary by Ted Delorme)

subject: librivox; audiobook; literature; satire; philosophy;religion; critic;
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text

reviews.reviewbody: Excellent reading! Very good story telling and characterization. As good as a professional recording - I enjoyed listening to it.
This is done real well.  Enjoying listening very much.  Thanks
Excellent.  May very well help me pass my Literature class!
This is a splendid reading..no performance is a better word! Thank you.
Everything is right on target with this reading. Ted Delorme has a gift for doing different voices convincingly.
Great reading of a hilarious story, with lots of good satire.
